Message.Title: AMZN Price Action
Message.Msg: When you look at this stock, it is clear that it is manipulated constantly with 3 pt. pops for no reason every day or other day to frustrate stocks and induce short covering. It's nothing but a scam that has become part of the Wall St. establishment. No prudent investor should back a stock that doesn't produce anything itself and relies on volume at the expense of margins to generate profit. But what happens when sales growth slows, as is the case now. Isn't our materialistic society maxed out enough? The trend is thrift, not paying retail for items. And if AMZN is another EBAY, then it should not command such an outrageous multiple of 200+ based on next year's expected earnings.

Message.Title: Amazon Selling Revisionist HS Text Book
Message.Msg: Amazon is selling to HS across this nation a complete Revisionist United States History Book called; United States History "Preparing for the Advanced Placement Examination, by John J Newman and John M Schmalbach. It completely changes the wording in most of the Bill of Rights such as "The people have the right to keep and bear arms in a state militia". There are people also on Amazon on the sell site that are trying to defend this brainwashing effort. Is your local HS using this book? Are your HS children being intentionally mislead?

Message.Title: This Article Should Be Killing AMZN today
Message.Msg: Retail sales during the 2013 holiday shopping season are forecast to rise by 2.4%, but store traffic is expected to decline by 1.4% from year-ago levels. Compared with last year’s sales gain of 3%, this year has got to be something of a disappointment for retailers. Sales also rose more in 2011 and 2010 -- 4% and 3.8%, respectively. The data was published Tuesday by research firm ShopperTrak and is the first estimate we’ve see on prospects for this year’s holiday season. Store sales during the period between Thanksgiving and Christmas typically account for about 20% of a retail store’s annual sales. ShopperTrak estimates sales based on its surveys of shopper traffic to thousands of U.S. retail stores. The firm’s estimates do not include online sales, which last year represented about 7.3% of all holiday sales. The calendar is also working against retailers this year with six few days between Black Friday and Christmas. An early start to Hanukkah will help drive a move to earlier promotions. ShopperTrak’s founder noted: Nobody can afford to procrastinate. Retailers must have their holiday marketing and operations ready to go when November begins, as consumers will be ready to take advantage of those deals.

Topic.Title: What NutJob is buyin AMZN $304P/E 110 and selling AAPL @ $460 ?????

Message.Msg: Because the market "valuations" are driven solely by how they trade (technicals/flows). The damage it is causing to the economy and your children's future is hard to overstate. The malinvestment in things that create NO societal value and that create burdens on the future rather than productive capacity is extraordinary. Everyone wants to blame it on the Fed. I strongly disapprove of what the Fed has done (owners of financial assets should have had to eat the losses...), but it doesn't justify the market becoming one giant trading/float jam scam. That has been driven by the confluence of long only institutions trading options and HFT/quant algos abusing the system. Multiples have become a function of institutional control of float (amplified by the presence of certain quant funds...) rather than earnings and earnings growth. This time, the financial institutions are going to have to realize losses. This time, all the phantom wealth in financial assets will get destroyed. Those in the finance sector are in for a very rude awakening because value capture will realign with value creation (meaning total compensation in real terms will be a modest fraction of what it is today). It will be painful for everyone, but we will end up in a much better place in the end...

Topic.Title: What NutJob is buyin AMZN $304P/E 110 and selling AAPL @ $460 ?????

Message.Msg: That is certainly my perspective as well - not as well thought out, but the same concept of "the underlying reality is not good ... and sooner or later it will rebalance." It is also the concept of many others. The question is, when will it take place. Do you have any sort time frame you are looking at? Would you say usually these things (a big decline to normal valuations) don't really announce themselves too well? Let's see what this week brings with the "tapering" talk tomorrow.

Topic.Title: What NutJob is buyin AMZN $304P/E 110 and selling AAPL @ $460 ?????

Message.Msg: Honestly, I expected it to happen about a year ago. I has hoped that TPTB would use QE34EVER to let the bubblicious float jam scams go and actually do the right damn thing (moving back to valuations based upon fundamentals). They didn't. They hyperextended it instead. Behavioral finance. Now, people will be anchored to these completely absurd valuations and more unsophisticated investors will be hurt. Trust is the casualty. Market economies cannot function properly without trust. Volumes are drying up in the markets and it will only get worse. Eventually, people will realize that WS is simply a giant skimming operation these days... When it returns to focus on lending, investment banking (IPO, M&A, etc), it will have value again. Until then, it is simply glorified theft...
